page.title: 13AMENITIES IN S.ELKINGTON
page.content: In the centre of the village there is a General Store and Off-Licence, which is also the Post Office,and a Public Telephone.One daily postal delivery and two collections.Part of village is on the Louth/Lincoln bus route giving a daily service and on market days a shoppers bus serves the village.Milk is delivered 4 times a week to houses close to Louth;for others the shop is the collecting point.The library van visits weekly, stopping alternately at two places. Refuse collected from all houses once weekly.A central gas main provides service to adjacent houses, and there is footway lighting,given by Mr.and Mrs.B. Dobson in memory of their late daughter.The community policeman lives in Binbrook.Social functions are held at the Church Institute.Council cesspit emptying and snow clearance supplemented by farmers
